title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 17
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: The bank was closed at no distant period, and theagent, it is said, lost L1500 of his own money. No other banking companyattempted to establish a bank in Anstruther till May 1832, when theNational Bank of Scotland opened a branch under the management of Mr F.Conolly, town-clerk, which he conducted successfully for twenty-five years. A handsome new building has lately been erected for the use of this bank.
